title: Roasted Banana Whiskey Ice Cream Recipe
description: Butter-roasted bananas and your favorite bourbon whiskey flavor this just-for-grownups ice cream, made with a cream and egg custard the old fashioned way.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Fruit Desserts Banana Dessert Recipes Roasted Banana Whiskey Ice Cream 4.3 (6) 4 Reviews 3 Photos Big banana flavor in a rich creamy ice cream, made even richer with the addition of whiskey. Banana at its best! Submitted by Jennifer Rehnke Published on June 18, 2020 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 5 hrs 30 mins Total Time: 6 hrs 15 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 6 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 cup very ripe bananas ½ teaspoon butter, melted 1 egg 1 ¼ cups white sugar ¼ cup brown sugar 1 tablespoon good quality bourbon whiskey (such as Maker's Mark®) 2 cups heavy cream Directions Peel the bananas, cut into 2 or 3 chunks, and freeze until solid. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place the frozen banana pieces into a baking dish; drizzle with melted butter. Roast the bananas in the preheated oven until browned, about 20 minutes. Mash the bananas in a bowl, and chill in refrigerator. In a bowl, whisk together the egg, white sugar, brown sugar, and bourbon whiskey until smooth. Pour the cream into a heavy saucepan over medium-low heat, and bring to a simmer. Whisk about 1 cup of the hot cream into the egg mixture, 1 tablespoon at a time, incorporating each tablespoon before adding the next; pour the mixture back into the saucepan with remaining cream. Over medium-low heat, constantly whisk the cream mixture until thickened and almost boiling; stir in the mashed bananas. Transfer to a bowl and chill 4 hours to overnight. Pour the ice cream base into an ice cream maker, and freeze according to manufacturer's instructions; pack soft ice cream into a lidded container and freeze until firm, at least 1 hour. Add Your Photo Photos of Roasted Banana Whiskey Ice Cream 01 of 03 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 03 Photo by  Loves2Cook 07/26/2011 Jennr, thank you sooo much for posting this recipe! I think this is the best ice cream I've ever made. My husband said it's to die for! I didn't have bourbon whiskey so I subbed Capt Morgan rum. Served with a warm butter rum syrup and chopped walnuts. 1 You’ll Also Love Irish Cream Crème Brûlée 208 Ratings Steph's Bourbon Balls 18 Ratings Bananas Foster 1,132 Ratings Chef John's Bananas Foster 33 Ratings Frozen Lemon Pavlova 4 Ratings Kentucky Banana Pudding 171 Ratings Orange Blossom Trifle 21 Ratings Penny's Whiskey Cake 50 Ratings Skinny Foster 14 Ratings Flambe for Two 4 Ratings Cheesecake Ice Cream 14 Ratings Jim's Apple Raisin Pound Cake with Praline Glaze 17 Ratings Ultimate Irish Cream Chocolate Mousse 37 Ratings Homemade Pumpkin Frozen Yogurt 7 Ratings Banana Rum Cake 67 Ratings Slow Cooker Bananas Foster 47 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Jennifer Rehnke
instructions: Peel the bananas, cut into 2 or 3 chunks, and freeze until solid.;Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place the frozen banana pieces into a baking dish; drizzle with melted butter.;Roast the bananas in the preheated oven until browned, about 20 minutes. Mash the bananas in a bowl, and chill in refrigerator.;In a bowl, whisk together the egg, white sugar, brown sugar, and bourbon whiskey until smooth. Pour the cream into a heavy saucepan over medium-low heat, and bring to a simmer. Whisk about 1 cup of the hot cream into the egg mixture, 1 tablespoon at a time, incorporating each tablespoon before adding the next; pour the mixture back into the saucepan with remaining cream. Over medium-low heat, constantly whisk the cream mixture until thickened and almost boiling; stir in the mashed bananas. Transfer to a bowl and chill 4 hours to overnight.;Pour the ice cream base into an ice cream maker, and freeze according to manufacturer's instructions; pack soft ice cream into a lidded container and freeze until firm, at least 1 hour.
